'Acetazolamide', sometimes sold under the trade name 'Diamox' in some countries,
is a carbonic anhydrase inhibitor that is used for the medical treatment of
glaucoma, epileptic seizure, idiopathic intracranial hypertension (a.k.a.
pseudotumor cerebri), altitude sickness, cystinuria, periodic paralysis, central
sleep apnea, and dural ectasia. Acetazolamide is a diuretic, and it is available
as a generic drug in the United States. Diamox is now available as Diamox
Sequels in the United States since the original product is no longer made or
sold there.
